features: LAVA CERAMIC SOLEPLATE: The CHI Lava Iron's soleplate is engineered with volcanic lava combined with the power of CHI ceramic. This innovative combination of elements creates extreme durability, excellent heat conduction and an extra-smooth glide.

ONE PASS IS ALL IT TAKES WITH CHI LAVA: Enjoy effortless glide-ability for an incredibly smooth ironing experience. This clothing iron's advanced lava technology gives you the exceptional glide that you can only expect from CHI.

POWERFUL STEAM: With over 400 steam holes, the CHI Lava Iron delivers powerful steam to remove wrinkles effortlessly. You'll have all the steam power you need to quickly remove wrinkles from every kind of fabric, from cotton and denim to linen and silk.
ELECTRONIC TEMPERATURE CONTROL WITH FABRIC GUIDE: Choose your fabric type using the illuminated control, and the iron sets the temperature accordingly, eliminating the guesswork.
EASY STORAGE WITH RETRACTABLE CORD: The 8 ft. cord retracts to a customizable length with the touch of a button.
body.description: The CHI® Lava™ Electronic Iron with Retractable Cord is engineered with volcanic lava combined with the power of CHI ceramic. This innovative combination of elements creates extreme durability, excellent heat conduction and an extra-smooth glide.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Powerful Steam for Effortless Ironing With over 400 steam holes, it delivers powerful steam that quickly removes wrinkles from every kind of fabric.

From hair to wear. From the world-renowned brand that has innovated the haircare industry for over 30 years, comes a high-performance line of irons and steamers for all the fabrics of your home and wardrobe. Engineered with CHI flat iron technology, and designed for the modern home, these products deliver the precise results you can only expect from CHI. CHI Lava Electronic Iron with Retractable Cord Whether your definition of a polished look is a well-pressed suit, a smooth silk dress or a wrinkle-free shirt for work, you can achieve it with the CHI Lava Electronic Iron with Retractable Cord. Like our haircare tools, the CHI Lava Electronic Iron gives you the high-performance power of the pros at home. Engineered with our most durable soleplate coating to date — lava ceramic — the CHI Lava Electronic Iron provides extreme durability, excellent heat conduction and an extra-smooth glide. The glide-ability is so effortless, one pass is all it takes. Electronic temperature control with fabric guide lets you easily select your fabric type 8' cord is retractable for easy storage Auto shutoff feature provides peace of mind Textured comfort grip handle feels great in your hand and provides comfortable ironing

Lava Ceramic Soleplate — Our Most Durable Soleplate Coating The CHI Lava Iron's soleplate is engineered with volcanic lava combined with the power of CHI ceramic. This innovative combination of elements creates extreme durability, excellent heat conduction and an extra-smooth glide. One Pass is All it Takes with CHI Lava Enjoy effortless glide-ability for an incredibly smooth ironing experience. From smoothly gliding over pant legs and hems to shirt collars and seams, this iron's advanced lava technology gives you the exceptional glide that you can only expect from CHI. Powerful Steam for Effortless Ironing With over 400 steam holes, the CHI Lava Iron delivers powerful steam to remove wrinkles effortlessly. You'll have all the steam power you need to quickly remove wrinkles from every kind of fabric, from cotton and denim to linen and silk.

Electronic Temperature Control with Fabric Guide Choose your fabric type using the illuminated control, and the iron sets the temperature accordingly, eliminating the guesswork. The adjustable steam lever goes from no steam to full power with just a quick slide. Easy Storage with Retractable Cord The 8 ft. cord retracts to a customizable length with the touch of a button. It stays out of your way when you don't need it, and when you iron, the cord's long length ensures that it easily reaches an outlet. Added Peace of Mind with Auto Shutoff Ever worry that you forgot to turn your iron off? You won't anymore. This iron turns off within 60 seconds if it falls on its face or side or in 30 minutes if it's left unattended on its heel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Old returned Iron???
reviews.reviewText: Update: exchanged the iron for the same one. I’m thinking somehow I may have gotten a returned item and the new one is immaculate so upping my stars. I used to buy rowenta irons. Last time around I bought the chi and a rowenta knowing one would go back. The rowenta just didn’t get the heat like the chi does.I sew and need a new iron every couple of years. I bought a Chi last time and loved it. THIS one is leaving black marks on my fabric so I looked close at the soleplate and there residue on it! I do not have the box but I am returning or exchanging this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely LOVE it
reviews.reviewText: This is the loveliest beast of an iron I have EVER used! Perfect weight, the electronic temp gauge takes the guesswork out, and the wrinkles disappear! I sew for a living and have searched for a new work iron since my R0w3nta died; this is my new favorite. Bravo!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Glides well, supreme steam
reviews.reviewText: I had an inexpensive old Sunbeam Iron that didn't spray or steam well anymore so I upgraded to this CHI iron. I knew the CHI brand for hair-straighteners but I didn't realize they made clothing irons too!The CHI iron has a retractable cord which is a feature I love (my old iron had one too). I had to read the manual to figure out how to fill it with water. My old iron came with a cup with narrow pour spout. Since this iron came with nothing, I used the one from my old iron to fill this iron. I noticed right away that it holds way more water than my old iron, which is great! I would think it's unnecessary to use distilled water & using tap water is fine. I found it odd that the manual said NOT to use distilled water as if something bad would happen if you did. I can't imagine what's wrong with distilled water because it's just less dissolved ions.Anyway, the iron got hot fast and beeps when the pre-heating is done (about 2 minutes). With an electronic temperature controller you don't have as many temperature options. This gives the iron some simplicity. The iron glides well over the surface. The iron has some automatic off features (1 minute if on face or side, 30 minutes if sitting upright). The iron also has a "self-clean" button.I used the maximum steam possible to iron some cotton dresses. These dresses had not been ironed in several years. The iron has far more steam holes than my previous iron. The iron was very efficient at smoothing the fabric. Maybe not one pass, but it was fast. A full tank of water got me through three dresses.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Powerful Steam Iron
reviews.reviewText: The Chi steam iron was a nice upgrade from my old Shark iron machine it was surprisingly big in size but very ergonomic when it comes to handling it and using it. I loved the design and the sleek look of the Chi a lot.The controls of the temperature and steam are very easy to use and the placement of the fabric modes over the water reservoir opening is very smart and convenient. Loved that the water reservoir opening had a part that prevented water bubbling and spelling outside.The Chi steam iron took a bit longer to heat up but I am assuming it's bigger surface is contributing to this.I Love the retractable cord it does keep the ironing space clean and tidy and prevents accidents but I wish the cord was longer to give more room to move freely.The steam feature is great and helps with stubborn wrinkles, Nothing crazy or powerful but good enough to iron and steam clothes but I don't see it as a standalone steamer nor it's designed to be a steamer.This Chi steam iron is amazing and I love the way it looks and no complaints at all about the temperature. Solid product and highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy Duty Iron
reviews.reviewText: Heavy Duty IronThis is CHI Steam Iron for Clothes with 8’ Retractable Cord, 1700 Watts, 3-Way Auto Shutoff, 400+ Holes, Professional Grade, Temperature Control Dial, Lava Infused Ceramic Soleplate - Black (13113)Users of all experience levels are provided for in this iron's amazing overall design and functionality. Its pointed-end design makes it ideal for use on collars, shirts, and other difficult-to-reach areas. It works well for both regular and specialized wear. Superior to the standard size, the retractable cord and cord length provide additional length. Both for use and storage, there are numerous safety features. Based on which way the iron is pointed, this iron has a built-in self-timer that will automatically turn off after a set amount of time. The smooth glide and the more than 400 steam openings have impressed me. It deserves 4.5⭐️Stars. Hope you find this review helpful.The iron's general feel and weight make it comfortable to use for extended periods. Ironing wrinkled fabrics is made easier by its various mode settings, which include cotton, linen, wool, silk, and synthetic settings.I wholeheartedly endorse this iron, particularly if you're looking to replace your old family iron. It features an extra-long cord, operates quickly and efficiently, and regulates the steam and stream output. Both using and storing it are quite easy. All in all, this iron is excellent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great iron, but very pricey
reviews.reviewText: This is a great iron that works with a variety of different fabrics. The features of steam and mist are also a huge added bonus. My complaint would be the retractable cord. It has difficulty retracting without help. However, I didn’t think that was a reason to give is less than 5 stars. I do think it’s pricey, so it’s for sure a preference of user!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great iron, excellent glide, and lots of steam
reviews.reviewText: ⁦I bought this iron and it's the best iron I have ever owned. It really fits all your needs. I just wanted everyone to know that this is money well spent. It handles the most stubborn wrinkles, those that are extremely hard to get out. With this iron, it's as if they never existed. A fantastic iron with a large water reservoir, digital display, and great performance, the iron sole plate glides easily and has a narrow point that is good for ironing collars, and cuffs, and for pressing seams open when sewing. The iron does get very hot. When ironing cotton you can use the wool setting if you don't want the iron to be too hot. I think it is better to use distilled water. For other irons, I have used tap water and noticed over time that there was mineral build-up that stained materials when I ironed.
